CatDescriptText: Image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 16, 1946, pg. 3, in "Public Opinion" column, with question: "The Courier's Inquiring Reporter, on a brief tour of Hill District bars this week, found that local mixologists of color, had mixed feelings when approached with the question: 'Do you think that local Negro bartenders should affiliate themselves with organized labor?" Image cutline reads: "Joe Richardson, 1940 Webster Avenue, Weitz's Cafe, Centre Avenue at Dinwiddie Street.  'Yes, because if they affiliate, they'll get a better break...get more salary.  I think they should be in same union as the white bartenders..if they can qualify.  As it stands now, they don't get paid enough, That's what they need.'"
TitMainTitle: Portrait of bartender Joe Richardson holding cigarette behind bar, in front of display of bottles in cabinet with wood valance, round mirror, sign reading "Cocktails, wines, and liquors, and November Hogan Coal Company calendar, in Weitz's Cafe, Centre Avenue and Dinwiddie Street
